description: A vast desert that makes up the majority of Arabasta's uninhabited land. The harsh, unforgiving landscape is controlled by Crocodile's sand powers, making it the perfect battlefield for the Warlord.

keyEvents.title: Hasami Transports Crew Across Desert
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats ride Hasami the giant crab across the Sandora Desert toward Alubarna in a desperate race against time.
keyEvents.significance: The desert serves as the main setting for this episode's events.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs Crocodile Round 1
keyEvents.description: The desert becomes the battleground for Luffy and Crocodile's first serious fight, with Crocodile having complete environmental advantage.
keyEvents.significance: The location emphasizes Crocodile's dominance and the harsh reality Luffy faces.

keyEvents.title: Desert Girasole Creates Quicksand
keyEvents.description: Crocodile uses the desert terrain itself as a weapon, creating massive sinkholes of quicksand.
keyEvents.significance: Shows how the desert environment enhances Crocodile's already formidable powers.

statusHistory.reason: Desert remains as major geographical feature of Arabasta

description: A massive river approximately 50 kilometers wide that runs through the center of Arabasta, dividing the kingdom. The river serves as a natural barrier that even desert creatures like Hasami cannot cross.

keyEvents.title: Reaching the Sandora River
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats reach the Sandora River on Hasami, but must dismount as the crab cannot cross water.
keyEvents.significance: The river creates a vulnerable moment for the crew, setting up their confrontation with Crocodile.

statusHistory.reason: River remains a major geographical feature of Arabasta
